revisions:
[{'created': '2012-10-12 23:26:21.000000000', 'message': "xenapi: fix bfv behavior when SR is not attached

Fixes bug 1063920
If we try to boot from volume right after a detach volume operation
on the xensm volume driver, the SR has been disconnected. This results
in a failure to populate the vdis list. Introducing the SR if it
isn't in the xapi db fixes this.

Change-Id: I7e6b5e643ea3e20ba691141950cddfcb0ab5f3b8
"}, {'created': '2012-10-15 19:42:56.000000000', 'message': "xenapi: fix bfv behavior when SR is not attached

Fixes bug 1063920
If we try to boot from volume right after a detach volume operation
on the xensm volume driver, the SR has been disconnected. This results
in a failure to populate the vdis list. Introducing the SR if it
isn't in the xapi db fixes this.

Change-Id: I7e6b5e643ea3e20ba691141950cddfcb0ab5f3b8
"}, {'created': '2012-10-17 23:07:57.000000000', 'message': "xenapi: fix bfv behavior when SR is not attached

Fixes bug 1063920
If we try to boot from volume right after a detach volume operation
on the xensm volume driver, the SR has been disconnected. This results
in a failure to populate the vdis list. Introducing the SR if it
isn't in the xapi db fixes this.

Change-Id: I7e6b5e643ea3e20ba691141950cddfcb0ab5f3b8
"}]
commit_message:
xenapi: fix bfv behavior when SR is not attached

Fixes bug 1063920
If we try to boot from volume right after a detach volume operation
on the xensm volume driver, the SR has been disconnected. This results
in a failure to populate the vdis list. Introducing the SR if it
isn't in the xapi db fixes this.

Change-Id: I7e6b5e643ea3e20ba691141950cddfcb0ab5f3b8

commit_message:
heat-keystone-setup avoid adding existing role to user

On folsom keystone has a user-role-list option, which we
can use to detect an existing user which already has the
requested role

Change-Id: Ic6f843bc47fe3aaa44a4e96c263fb946ea35bf7e
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-10-09 22:24:08.000000000', 'message': "Clean up is_public filtering in image_get_all

Prior to this patch, is_public filtering was applied in a
counterintuitive and potentially dangerous manner. In particular,
is_public=True would return images where is_public=False. Also, in a
variety of cases (that weren't exposed in the http api) users could list
private images that they do not own. This patch fixes those problems by
making is_public filtering work the same as any other filter, adding an
extra argument to image_get_all to allow the v1 api to preserve its
existing behavior.

Fixes bug 1060481 and 1061331.

Change-Id: I086bd9273e337ebe184902b6f12bc8c9a7fc5867
"}, {'created': '2012-10-09 22:58:44.000000000', 'message': "Clean up is_public filtering in image_get_all

counterintuitive and potentially dangerous manner. In particular,
is_public=True would return images where is_public=False. Also, in a
variety of cases (that weren't exposed in the http api) users could list
private images that they do not own. This patch fixes those problems by
making is_public filtering work the same as any other filter, adding an
extra argument to image_get_all to allow the v1 api to preserve its
existing behavior.

Fixes bug 1060481 and 1061331.

Change-Id: I086bd9273e337ebe184902b6f12bc8c9a7fc5867
"}, {'created': '2012-10-09 23:04:43.000000000', 'message': "Clean up is_public filtering in image_get_all

Prior to this patch, is_public filtering was applied in a
counterintuitive and potentially dangerous manner. In particular,
is_public=True would return images where is_public=False. Also, in a
variety of cases (that weren't exposed in the http api) users could list

Fixes bug 1060481 and 1061331.

Change-Id: I086bd9273e337ebe184902b6f12bc8c9a7fc5867
"}, {'created': '2012-10-09 23:21:01.000000000', 'message': "Clean up is_public filtering in image_get_all

Prior to this patch, is_public filtering was applied in a
counterintuitive and potentially dangerous manner. In particular,
is_public=True would return images where is_public=False. Also, in a
variety of cases (that weren't exposed in the http api) users could list
private images that they do not own. This patch fixes those problems by

Fixes bug 1060481.
Fixes bug 1061331.

Change-Id: I086bd9273e337ebe184902b6f12bc8c9a7fc5867
"}, {'created': '2012-10-10 07:17:26.000000000', 'message': 'Clean up is_public filtering in image_get_all

Prior to this patch, is_public filtering was applied in a
counterintuitive and potentially dangerous manner. In particular,
is_public=True would return images where is_public=False. Also, in a
variety of cases (that weren't exposed in the http api) users could list
private images that they do not own. This patch fixes those problems by
making is_public filtering work the same as any other filter and adding
separate visibility restrictions that always apply to list queries. To
preserve the existing behavior of the v1 api where admins by default do
not see all private images, admin contexts are deescalated to normal
contexts in certain situations.

With this change, pep8 ignores E712 because it is normal to use
"column == True" in sqlalchemy.

commit_message:
Clean up is_public filtering in image_get_all

Prior to this patch, is_public filtering was applied in a
counterintuitive and potentially dangerous manner. In particular,
is_public=True would return images where is_public=False. Also, in a
variety of cases (that weren't exposed in the http api) users could list
private images that they do not own. This patch fixes those problems by
making is_public filtering work the same as any other filter and adding
separate visibility restrictions that always apply to list queries. To
preserve the existing behavior of the v1 api where admins by default do
not see all private images, admin contexts are deescalated to normal
contexts in certain situations.

With this change, pep8 ignores E712 because it is normal to use
"column == True" in sqlalchemy.

Fixes bug 1060481.
Fixes bug 1061331.

Change-Id: I086bd9273e337ebe184902b6f12bc8c9a7fc5867

commit_message:
Avoid leaking BDMs for deleted instances.

Fixes bug 1069099

Previously when an instance was deleted, the corresponding entries
in the block device mappings table were not also marked as deleted.

Change-Id: I0184eb2f02a9ed363019c585efffdfdb95f0bb43

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-10-12 22:42:42.000000000', 'message': "read_deleted snapshot and volume id mappings.

Since the migration that creates the volume_id_mappings and
snapshot_id_mappings tables does not populate the 'deleted' column,
queries to this table should not limit results to 'deleted=0'.
Limiting to non-deleted rows results in duplicate mappings being
created for existing instance mappings after an upgrade, and
throws off volume and snapshot ID to UUID mapping.

This is a stop-gap measure to ensure avoid serious breakage during
an upgrade.  The NULL columns in this table are actually unused
currently and can be populated in later grizzly migrations, if they
end up being used.

Fixes bug 1065785.

Change-Id: I893c994362a203288b9984f0ede24cbb274bfcc5
(cherry picked from commit 43bf8344488a6af1046344c255bdb2edd7450475)
"}]
commit_message:
read_deleted snapshot and volume id mappings.

Since the migration that creates the volume_id_mappings and
snapshot_id_mappings tables does not populate the 'deleted' column,
queries to this table should not limit results to 'deleted=0'.
Limiting to non-deleted rows results in duplicate mappings being
created for existing instance mappings after an upgrade, and
throws off volume and snapshot ID to UUID mapping.

This is a stop-gap measure to ensure avoid serious breakage during
an upgrade.  The NULL columns in this table are actually unused
currently and can be populated in later grizzly migrations, if they
end up being used.

Fixes bug 1065785.

Change-Id: I893c994362a203288b9984f0ede24cbb274bfcc5
(cherry picked from commit 43bf8344488a6af1046344c255bdb2edd7450475)

commit_message:
Compare token expiry without seconds

There is a rounding problem that occurs periodically.  Token expiration
Does not need to be confirmed to this level of granularity.

Bug 1045962

Change-Id: I361c5cf309c47b142c35c4359234fd0e44005e5a

so make them check the response format, which should be a stackid

commit_message:
heat tests : refactor stackid check into utils.Stack

Rework utils.Stack._check_stackid so it can be used in the
tests to verify stackid format, avoiding maintaining multiple
copies of a stackid regex

Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Updated flavor.py to support new deployment scenarios where instances are not only being deployed vitually,
but are also being deployed to bare metal devics. NTT, AMD, Cisco and others are currently implementing this method.
I updated the definition of vcpu to include physical CPU's to reflect the use of that field in multiple current implementations.

Change-Id: Id8070649ff978fa64a76209d53a40b1dde116eb2

'}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2012-10-19 19:31:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

Good with the code - please add more docstring detail (params, returns) since moving it to Identity core effectively makes it a first-class method that will need to be implemented by all potential back-ends"}, {'account_id': 2340, 'date': '2012-10-22 15:26:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2340, 'date': '2012-10-22 15:29:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Thanks Joe. I added a :returns: to the docstring, but I'm not sure what the doc syntax is for params. I couldn't find anything similar in the other docstrings in this file.

About other classes re-implementing it, I'm not sure that's the case. I put the function here precisely so it doesn't have to get re-implemented assuming that all identity backends return user dictionaries."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-10-22 16:11:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Doesn't seem to work

commit_message:
Add trove classifiers for PyPI

Add classifiers so we can eventually register the project
on PyPI to reserve the name, even though we won't release
packages there.

Change-Id: I9ef676ffd4a84cb149d7f5b6998c16c46e4181b8
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

request, API returns 401 response. Fixed this to return a 400 Bad Request
instead.
2. Also added unit test coverage.

Fixes LP: #1060723

Change-Id: I4861d5b989a151d8fce20f012bb0878b06b9b559
'}, {'created': '2012-10-22 11:57:30.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes response for missing credentials in auth

commit_message:
Fixes response for missing credentials in auth

1. If username or password parameters are not specified in the authentication
request, API returns 401 response. Fixed this to return a 400 Bad Request
instead.
2. Also added unit test coverage.

Fixes LP: #1060723

Change-Id: I4861d5b989a151d8fce20f012bb0878b06b9b559

commit_message:
Fix Not Found error, when router not match.

Fixes bug 1065234

when the router not match, keystone should return 404 error with
json format or xml format. Not the webob.exc.HTTPNotFound() in
html format.

Change-Id: I88e873b65db5df8393c0bb22db0e98712d77e350

commit_message:
Adding handling for get user/tenant by name

* /v2.0/tenants?name=<tenant_name>
* /v2.0/user?name=<user_name>
* added get_tenant_by_name() to tests/test_content_types.py
* added get_user_by_name() to tests/test_content_types.py

bug 1055763

Change-Id: Id30dc853db12e155238fbb39cef6a081284cb86c

Cleans up the code around exception handling and logging
when first authenticating (which often returns an unscoped token).
There's no need to be logging an exception on an expected empty
catalog and moreover the except block was a bare "except" which

Fixes bug 1070493

Change-Id: I5e791e95ce3f9ab77723a7f4698cb11b169dacfb

commit_message:
Don't log an exception for an expected empty catalog.

Cleans up the code around exception handling and logging
when first authenticating (which often returns an unscoped token).
There's no need to be logging an exception on an expected empty
catalog and moreover the except block was a bare "except" which
could mask other errors.

Fixes bug 1070493

Change-Id: I5e791e95ce3f9ab77723a7f4698cb11b169dacfb

Redo part of bp/sql-identiy-pam that was accidently undone by bug 968519.

We encapsulated the call to utils.check_password with a local method,
_check_password, to make it easier to subclass Identity. This allows us

commit_message:
bug 1068674

Redo part of bp/sql-identiy-pam that was accidently undone by bug 968519.

We encapsulated the call to utils.check_password with a local method,
_check_password, to make it easier to subclass Identity. This allows us
to use a different password checker without having to replace the entire
authenticate method in our code.  The fix for 968519 accidently removed
the call to the local method. *This* fix puts that call back in.

Updating comment because Jenkins failed due to build timeout in
unrelated test.

Change-Id: I69a3ba2d5a62e4c600edab7ef2cc07413c7360cc

[{'created': '2012-09-23 15:24:40.000000000', 'message': 'Handle floating ip resizing/migration in multi_host

In multi_host mode, floating ip(s) addr and NAT rules are still on
source node after resize/migrate instance. This patch fixes it up by
moving them to the destination node.

Fixes bug 1053344

commit_message:
Migrate network of an instance

In multi_host mode, floating ip(s) addr and NAT rules are still on
source node after resize/migrate instance. This patch fixes it up by
adding new methods in network.api to moving them to the destination
node.

Also adds the new methods to network/quantumv2/api.py. They do nothing
but pass for now.

This patch updates network RPC API to version 1.1

Fixes bug 1053344

Change-Id: If9f30050d37831f108ac4a1c8a018d820818f3b6

commit_message:
Remove stale APIs.

A number of APIs were introduced into the openstack-common incubation
repo, but have since gone stable.  Nobody is working on them and we
don't want anyone trying to use them.  We should only include code here
that is actively being worked on and being moved toward an eventual
library release.  Otherwise, it should be removed.

Change-Id: I8eeb10fc9a21bc35b3004fa19782ebeeba39d20d

commit_message:
Install the python-netaddr package before we use it.

It's used if installed and not used if not installed, which is confusing.
So trying to install it should make things a bit less confusing.

It's available under the same name in both Fedora and Ubuntu.

Change-Id: I6785dd5e831e9cf2da2eae5b116a9f5859c68c6d

(sorry for the mispelling of your name, don't know how to get the proper glyphs)"}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2012-09-27 21:33:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I don't want to approve without at least asking two questions:

1) Would X-Forwarded-For be more appropriate?

2) On the keystone side, I assume you're only using this header if the request is actually coming from dashboard? Otherwise, users could falsify the X-Forwarded-For header on direct requests. I don't think it's a security issue as long as it's clear when you can/can't trust the header."}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2012-09-29 18:40:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

pending answers to Dolph's questions"}, {'account_id': 2340, 'date': '2012-10-01 12:16:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thanks, Dolph, those are good points.

1. I'm not sure about this. It would mean we'd have to do more processing. When setting the header we'd have to be careful not to overwrite an existing header, but append to HTTP list instead. Then we'd have to do the same processing on the receiving end to extract the original IP from the HTTP list in X-Forwarded-For.

2. Sure. I think the easiest way to accomplish this is to check that the REMOTE_ADDR is not 127.0.0.1. If it is, then ignore it and use the other header instead. I guess I should add some documentation in keystone-client itself about this."}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2012-10-01 19:22:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

1. regardless of what the code looks like, is XFF more appropriate for the behavior you're looking for?"}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2012-10-01 19:23:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

2. I don't want to make hard coded assumptions about deployment, but 127.0.0.1 is a logical default value, as long as it can be overridden."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-10-09 06:03:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-10-09 06:03:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 2340, 'date': '2012-10-16 15:21:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Restored

i have a new commit'}, {'account_id': 2340, 'date': '2012-10-16 15:22:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2340, 'date': '2012-10-16 15:24:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 2340, 'date': '2012-10-16 15:28:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

So it seems there's a new draft ietf proposal for a Forwarded header [1]. I think we should use that. I've added a unit test, too.

The other security issues that were raised will need to be solved on keystone's side. i.e. figuring out where the request came from (dashboard or not) and which remote_ip to consider as belonging to the user.

[1] http://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-appsawg-http-forwarded-10"}, {'account_id': 2340, 'date': '2012-10-16 15:36:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-10-16 15:54:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

commit_message:
add a new HTTPClient attr for setting the original IP

The original IP is useful in cases where keystoneclient is used by a
different openstack component and we need to know who made the original
request. Otherwise it gets overwritten by e.g. Dashboard's host's IP.

bug 1046837

Change-Id: Ic22c565e92010afd89c8573c375919215b70d73d

commit_message:
Exception handling for 'nova flavor-create' arguments

Fixes client side Bug #1056935

Throws an exception if the user does not input integers for the
corresponding parameters.

Change-Id: I4c4b8148f6565bc5a3b348dbde8c2cf0da00234a

[{'created': '2012-10-23 20:51:08.000000000', 'message': 'Add virt driver capabilities definition

Going forward with the early stages of no-db-compute, we will
consistently hit cases where we need to eject some database usage
from one virt driver up a few layers. Since those are not commonly
used by all, some way of determining (and the higher layer) the
properties of the virt driver being used will be useful.

We have discussed using something like a mixin interface class
and multiple inheritance. We have discussed tricks like detecting
if the manage_image_cache() method has been overridden. We have
discussed trying it once and catching NotImplementedError and then
never trying again. Aside from the first, none of these are
unsneaky enough to bite us later.

This approach will provide us a clean way to declare such properties
succinctly in the compute driver to help the higher layers know
what we want them to do on our behalf. The implementation may look a
little heavyweight at the moment, but I think it should help us
ensure that properties in this object get documented and typed
appropriately going forward.

Change-Id: I74dea9322a5b4688319ebf5d9afe416e93401c58

commit_message:
Add virt driver capabilities definition

Going forward with the early stages of no-db-compute, we will
consistently hit cases where we need to eject some database usage
from one virt driver up a few layers. Since those are not commonly
used by all, some way of determining (and the higher layer) the
properties of the virt driver being used will be useful.

We have discussed using something like a mixin interface class
and multiple inheritance. We have discussed tricks like detecting
if the manage_image_cache() method has been overridden. We have
discussed trying it once and catching NotImplementedError and then
never trying again. Aside from the first, none of these are
unsneaky enough to bite us later.

This approach will provide us a way to declare such properties
succinctly in the compute driver to help the higher layers know
what we want them to do on our behalf.

Change-Id: I74dea9322a5b4688319ebf5d9afe416e93401c58

commit_message:
Move mkfs from libvirt.utils to utils

Related to blueprint xenapi-config-drive

Move mkfs function to nova.utils, so configdrive module does not depend
on the libvirt module. This way, the configdrive module could be used
by other virt modules.

Change-Id: Ibda2aacfa0b66bc087e397df1474b5dfbe86d923

commit_message:
Merge in update openstack-common policy code

Updates Glance-specific policy glue code to eliminate deprecated
openstack-common policy interfaces.  Also cleans up policy code
to allow for returning fine-grained policy values.

Change-Id: I2951a0de3751bd2ec868e7a661070fed624e4af2

The directory tests TestContainerPathsEnv creates directorys during SetUp while indicating duplicate application internet media type (MIME) via the Content-Type header.

E.g the output on the line using 'nosetests -v test.functional.tests:TestContainerPaths.testContainerListing' includes:

Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
Accept-Encoding: identity
Content-Type: application/octet-stream
Content-Length: 0
content-type: application/directory
X-Auth-Token: AUTH_tkd40f5550289d4d60af75bb1b6c6067be

On branch bp/wsgi-application-interface-3
   modified:   test/functional/tests.py
Fixes: Bug #1068499
Implements Blueprint  	wsgi-application-interface

Change-Id: I49c5d1f73fff3c06d4be18b20c7209eff4e1326c
"}]
commit_message:
Two MIME types sent during test

The directory tests TestContainerPathsEnv creates directorys during SetUp while indicating duplicate application internet media type (MIME) via the Content-Type header.

E.g the output on the line using 'nosetests -v test.functional.tests:TestContainerPaths.testContainerListing' includes:

Host: 127.0.0.1:8080
Accept-Encoding: identity
Content-Type: application/octet-stream
Content-Length: 0
content-type: application/directory
X-Auth-Token: AUTH_tkd40f5550289d4d60af75bb1b6c6067be

On branch bp/wsgi-application-interface-3
   modified:   test/functional/tests.py
Fixes: Bug #1068499
Implements Blueprint  	wsgi-application-interface

Change-Id: I49c5d1f73fff3c06d4be18b20c7209eff4e1326c

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-10-18 21:58:27.000000000', 'message': "Track unlinks of async_pendings.

It's not sufficient to just look at swift.object-updater.successes to
see the async_pending unlink rate. There are two different spots where
unlinks happen: one when an async_pending has been successfully
processed, and another when the updater notices multiple
async_pendings for the same object. Both events are now tracked under
the same name: swift.object-updater.unlinks.

Change-Id: I8c1493784adbe24ba2b5512615e87669b3d94505
"}, {'created': '2012-10-20 03:13:14.000000000', 'message': "Track unlinks of async_pendings.

It's not sufficient to just look at swift.object-updater.successes to
see the async_pending unlink rate. There are two different spots where
unlinks happen: one when an async_pending has been successfully
processed, and another when the updater notices multiple
async_pendings for the same object. Both events are now tracked under
the same name: swift.object-updater.unlinks.

FakeLogger has now sprouted a couple of convenience methods for
testing logged metrics.

Also: bonus speling and, grammar fixes in the admin guide.

Change-Id: I8c1493784adbe24ba2b5512615e87669b3d94505
"}, {'created': '2012-10-23 17:33:48.000000000', 'message': "Track unlinks of async_pendings.

It's not sufficient to just look at swift.object-updater.successes to
see the async_pending unlink rate. There are two different spots where
unlinks happen: one when an async_pending has been successfully
processed, and another when the updater notices multiple
async_pendings for the same object. Both events are now tracked under
the same name: swift.object-updater.unlinks.

FakeLogger has now sprouted a couple of convenience methods for
testing logged metrics.

Fixed pep8 1.3.3's complaints in the files this diff touches.

Also: bonus speling and, grammar fixes in the admin guide.

Change-Id: I8c1493784adbe24ba2b5512615e87669b3d94505
"}]
commit_message:
Track unlinks of async_pendings.

It's not sufficient to just look at swift.object-updater.successes to
see the async_pending unlink rate. There are two different spots where
unlinks happen: one when an async_pending has been successfully
processed, and another when the updater notices multiple
async_pendings for the same object. Both events are now tracked under
the same name: swift.object-updater.unlinks.

FakeLogger has now sprouted a couple of convenience methods for
testing logged metrics.

Fixed pep8 1.3.3's complaints in the files this diff touches.

Also: bonus speling and, grammar fixes in the admin guide.

Change-Id: I8c1493784adbe24ba2b5512615e87669b3d94505

commit_message:
Handle the case where we encounter a snap shot correctly.

Fix the list in the qemu output and break out of the loop
when we encounter that instead of failing to parse.

Fixes bug 1070088.

commit_message:
Fix bug in a test for the scheduler DiskFilter.

There is an error in the logic for a unit test in the Scheduler DiskFilter.
We need to test the failure of the host_passes check with the
"test_disk_filter_fails" test.

Fixes bug 1070264.

Change-Id: Ib07f47b74a6634c573dca8fb4efa2d95b2e1ed87

can you use a uuid instead of the time, somehow? i imagine it wouldn't be very difficult to land two threaded requests in the same millisecond"}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2012-10-10 00:00:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I don't want to pay the cost for UUID generation. Two requests landed at the same millisecond would only mess up the sender, and would only be an issue if they were trying to perform a denial of service.  This fixes a real problem in the least overhead manner."}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2012-10-10 02:23:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

two issues, then: A) it's adding to the v2 contract and should be documented as an extension (along with /v2.0/tokens/revoked, and B) it looks like the 'issued_at' time will be revised every time the token is remotely validated, no?"}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2012-10-10 19:49:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

"it's adding to the v2 contract and should be documented as an extension (along with /v2.0/tokens/revoked)"

Yes, it adds to the contract.
Yes, revoked should be documented, along with the calls to fetch the certificates for verification

"it looks like the 'issued_at' time will be revised every time the token is remotely validated, no?"

No.  The issued_at time is put into the signed document, and never updated.  In the token backend, it will be stored in "extra" and never updated.'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2012-10-12 15:45:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I think issued_at can obviously standalone as a useful attribute, but can we document the remaining potential for a race condition? new bug?

Should I put this into the v3 spec for tokens as well? This also makes me want to change v3 token.expires to token.expires_at :)'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-10-18 19:23:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

commit_message:
Fixes Bug 1063852

Add in the issue time, to prevent a race condition where a token is issued and
revoked, and then a request for an additional token is processed identical
to the first.  Each token now contains the issue time to make it unique.

(moving changing default to PKI to separate review)

Change-Id: I26ed5b3bb31840f5baaf64dbcbeac477e4d71afd

commit_message:
Add the generation of the username and password for iSCSI target.

When a volume is created, a pair of username and password is generated by the
driver for tgtadm and ietadm.

Implementation of bpiSCSI-CHAP.

Change-Id: I4f382a96ba4553158dc609e8caf9e70486e30603

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-25 11:46:09.000000000', 'message': "Fix scrubber not scrubbing with swift backend

It seems the fix for bug #1052537 was incomplete, as I have found
glance-scrubber is still not completing it's work when run against a
swift backend.

With more investigation it seems the proper way to execute a
starmap/imap is to consume it within a loop. This can be replicated by
taking the simple web crawler example from http://eventlet.net/doc/ and
removing the for loop from around the imap call.

Fixes bug 1056127

Change-Id: I2d289666b99f3216a6d424dbbacbd2d10899263d
"}, {'created': '2012-09-26 15:46:28.000000000', 'message': "Fix scrubber not scrubbing with swift backend

It seems the fix for bug #1052537 was incomplete, as I have found
glance-scrubber is still not completing it's work when run against a
swift backend.

With more investigation it seems the proper way to execute a
starmap/imap is to consume it within a loop. This can be replicated by
taking the simple web crawler example from http://eventlet.net/doc/ and
removing the for loop from around the imap call.

Also:
* Add new test to check this failure against Swift (respects the
  GLANCE_TEST_SWIFT_CONF environment variable).

* Fix E125/E127 pep8 errors in the files touched

Fixes bug 1056127

Change-Id: I2d289666b99f3216a6d424dbbacbd2d10899263d
"}, {'created': '2012-10-05 10:09:22.000000000', 'message': "Fix scrubber not scrubbing with swift backend

It seems the fix for bug #1052537 was incomplete, as I have found
glance-scrubber is still not completing it's work when run against a
swift backend.

With more investigation it seems the proper way to execute a
starmap/imap is to consume it within a loop. This can be replicated by
taking the simple web crawler example from http://eventlet.net/doc/ and
removing the for loop from around the imap call.

Also:
* Add new test to check this failure against Swift (respects the
  GLANCE_TEST_SWIFT_CONF environment variable).

Fixes bug 1056127

Change-Id: I2d289666b99f3216a6d424dbbacbd2d10899263d

commit_message:
Fix scrubber not scrubbing with swift backend

It seems the fix for bug #1052537 was incomplete, as I have found
glance-scrubber is still not completing it's work when run against a
swift backend.

With more investigation it seems the proper way to execute a
starmap/imap is to consume it within a loop. This can be replicated by
taking the simple web crawler example from http://eventlet.net/doc/ and
removing the for loop from around the imap call.

Also:
* Add new test to check this failure against Swift (respects the
  GLANCE_TEST_SWIFT_CONF environment variable).

Fixes bug 1056127

Change-Id: I2d289666b99f3216a6d424dbbacbd2d10899263d

test_client sends a wrong size indication when testing
chunked data.
For example instead of sending:
   5\r\nabcde\r\n (which is inline with the standard)
The client would send:
   0x5\r\nabcde\r\n

On branch bp/wsgi-application-interface-2
  modified:   test/functional/swift_test_client.py

Change-Id: I7597dcd24adade009aead66f67674f361f3fe4fa
Fixes: Bug #1070036
Implements: Blueprint wsgi-application-interface
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes Ilegal chunk encoding by the test_client

test_client sends a wrong size indication when testing
chunked data.
For example instead of sending:
   5\r\nabcde\r\n (which is inline with the standard)
The client would send:
   0x5\r\nabcde\r\n

On branch bp/wsgi-application-interface-2
  modified:   test/functional/swift_test_client.py

Change-Id: I7597dcd24adade009aead66f67674f361f3fe4fa
Fixes: Bug #1070036
Implements: Blueprint wsgi-application-interface

[{'created': '2012-10-22 22:25:30.000000000', 'message': 'add port support when QuantumV2 subclass is used

fixes bug 1070045

Fix the current implementation by checking if FLAGS.network_api_class is a
subclass of nova.network.quantumv2.api.API.  Previously, the API would
not accept port references unless the network_api_class string was
anything other than the QuantumV2 class.  This limitation prevented
subclassing.

This changeset includes additional API unit tests focused on QuantumV2
and requested networks.

Change-Id: I6b7b7389e127ff8b084ac379cb9aebccc102620c
'}]
commit_message:
add port support when QuantumV2 subclass is used

fixes bug 1070045

Fix the current implementation by checking if FLAGS.network_api_class is a
subclass of nova.network.quantumv2.api.API.  Previously, the API would
not accept port references unless the network_api_class string was
anything other than the QuantumV2 class.  This limitation prevented
subclassing.

This changeset includes additional API unit tests focused on QuantumV2
and requested networks.

Change-Id: I6b7b7389e127ff8b084ac379cb9aebccc102620c

commit_message:
Add OpenStack trove classifier for PyPI

Add trove classifier to have the client listed among the
other OpenStack-related projets on PyPI.

commit_message:
Change useexisting to extend_existing to fix deprecation warnings.

This squelches a deprecation warning during installation.

We're already using extend_existing in other places, so I don't
think this causes any new version compatibility issues.

Fixes bug 925609.  (Already marked fixed, but this hits more cases.)

Includes some merges with a whitespace-cleanup fix.

Change-Id: Ia166e9184ed3e13753c5669a1006a3711738319a

Bug #1068970
We use percentage width to control the table's witdh instead of absolute
size.

commit_message:
Add OpenStack trove classifier for PyPI

Add trove classifier to have swift listed among the
other OpenStack-related projets on PyPI to reserve
the name, even though we won't release packages there.

Change-Id: I2c6cd2e37ea55d2bc2ddbba813ee2a190b1c90a9
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

commit_message:
Enable custom eventlet.wsgi.server log_format

* The default log format has duplicate info. (datetime etc)
* Reference: http://eventlet.net/doc/modules/wsgi.html
* contains information not shown elsewhere (wall_seconds, body_length)

Change-Id: I57917b62c1f2cc4bba06011191dcf0b5342d7d43

commit_message:
Sync with latest version of openstack.common.timeutils

Changes since last sync:

    - Added is_newer_than function
    - Normalize_time() always return naive object
    - Use pep8 v1.3.3

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-28 19:10:14.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes bug Snapshotting LXC instance fails

Fixes bug 1058273.

The path of the disk for snapshotting LXC instance is debugged.
Also, virt_dom.managedSave(0) and self._create_domain(domain=virt_dom)
are not called for LXC instance, because they are supported by libvirt.

Change-Id: Idf8275a0222b2eb289e16dd245f7721e17fce21d

commit_message:
Fixes bug Snapshotting LXC instance fails

Fixes bug 1058273.

The path of the disk for snapshotting LXC instance is debugged.
Also, virt_dom.managedSave(0) and self._create_domain(domain=virt_dom)
are not called for LXC instance, because they are supported by libvirt.

Change-Id: Idf8275a0222b2eb289e16dd245f7721e17fce21d

commit_message:
add test for create subnet with default gateway and conflict allocation pool

Create subnet with default gateway and conflict allocation pool should return
status code 409:
$ quantum subnet-create net1 --allocation-pool start=10.0.0.1,end=10.0.0.5 \
10.0.0.0/24
Found overlapping allocation pools:{u'start': u'10.0.0.1',
u'end': u'10.0.0.5'} 10.0.0.1 for subnet 10.0.0.0/24.

Change-Id: I8608314ad7899a752eea239dbe224e25c00a375b

commit_message:
Update policies

Merge in update openstack-common policy code.

Updates Nova-specific policy glue code to eliminate deprecated
openstack-common policy interfaces.  Also cleans up policy code
to allow for returning fine-grained policy values.

As a side effect, fixes bug 1039132.

Change-Id: I2951a0de3751bd2ec868e7a661070fed624e4af2

Hi,
I am not sure that this is a bug. Can you please look at http://code.google.com/p/netaddr/wiki/IPTutorial#Representing_IP_Subnets
Thanks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-10-23 15:27:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

(1 inline comment)

Code looks good to me.'}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2012-10-23 15:27:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

The bug is not a problem with the netaddr library, but more a behavior bug that results from an unintended subnet restriction.  When the prefix is missing, netaddr will silently defaults to the most restrictive prefix (/32 or /128).  Requiring an explicit subnet length will remove the user surprise and result in a better user experience.'}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2012-10-23 15:27:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

commit_message:
Add trove classifiers for PyPI

Add classifiers so we can eventually register the project
on PyPI to reserve the name, even though we won't release
packages there.

Change-Id: I35f4fd72de7781d3e01f1d122d5d3267544ffbd6
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

commit_message:
Merge OVSVethInterfaceDriver into OVSInterfaceDriver

Fixes bug 1049385

Due to some issues using OVS internal interfaces across namespaces
with OpenFlow controllers (bug 1048681), a patch introduced the
OVSVethInterfaceDriver in addition to the base OVSInterfaceDriver.
However, OVSVethInterfaceDriver is just a variation of OVSInterfaceDriver
and the difference is how to create an interface (OVS internal vs veth).
This patch merge OVSVethInterfaceDriver into OVSInterfaceDriver
by introducing a new flag 'ovs_use_veth' (which defaults to False).

Change-Id: Ie8b01e6776bf703f72a9e2a471b24e126f6e2322

commit_message:
Fix Broken XML Namespace Handling

nodeName is set to ns2:metadata and not just metadata when namespaces are
specified using first example in the defect. Use tip mentioned here [1]
to support namespaces properly.

Fix one more spot where prefixes were hard coded, causing test case to fail

Ensure that scheduler_hints are picked up from the correct namespace

[1] http://stackoverflow.com/questions/2528852/how-do-i-get-minidom-to-ignore-namespaces

Fixes bug 887191

Change-Id: Ie078f685fc347aed1dd65cba0476deb6e44e07c9

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-10-09 23:06:38.000000000', 'message': "Add version to network rpc API.

This patch adds versioning support for the nova-network rpc API.  During
Folsom development I added versioning to all rpc APIs with the exception
of network and volume.  I was holding off on those to see what the fate
of that code in nova was going to be for sure.  Adding it to the volume
API in nova doesn't make much sense at this point (but doing it in
Cinder does).  Since nova-network is sticking around for a while, it
seems worthwhile to add a version number to the API for any future
changes while the code is still in the tree.

There are plenty of things in this rpc API that could be cleaned up or
improved, but I held off on doing any of those things.  I would
recommend the same for anyone else (unless it's a bug that needs to be
fixed).  I think any further improvements should be focused on Quantum
integration with Nova or Quantum itself.

Fixes bug 1060197.

Change-Id: I63ce57657388166544202af9c44c2298ae551aea
"}]
commit_message:
Add version to network rpc API.

This patch adds versioning support for the nova-network rpc API.  During
Folsom development I added versioning to all rpc APIs with the exception
of network and volume.  I was holding off on those to see what the fate
of that code in nova was going to be for sure.  Adding it to the volume
API in nova doesn't make much sense at this point (but doing it in
Cinder does).  Since nova-network is sticking around for a while, it
seems worthwhile to add a version number to the API for any future
changes while the code is still in the tree.

There are plenty of things in this rpc API that could be cleaned up or
improved, but I held off on doing any of those things.  I would
recommend the same for anyone else (unless it's a bug that needs to be
fixed).  I think any further improvements should be focused on Quantum
integration with Nova or Quantum itself.

Fixes bug 1060197.

Change-Id: I63ce57657388166544202af9c44c2298ae551aea

commit_message:
heat engine : kill running greenthreads on stack_delete

Add logic to track running eventlet greenthreads and kill
them when we start a stack_delete.  This should avoid errors
where long-running greenthreads end up referencing stacks which
have subsequently been deleted.

Fixes #261
Ref #223

Change-Id: I0d10b6f2dad0efa1caec18a67a3cc66cc693ea24
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2012-10-23 10:58:34.000000000', 'message': "heat engine : Store all resource states to DB

Resources which haven't already been stored to the DB
should be committed regardless of state, otherwise resources
which take a long time to go from CREATE_IN_PROGRESS to
CREATE_COMPLETE (e.g WaitConditions) are invisible while
in the CREATE_IN_PROGRESS state to all except the thread
creating them.  Essentially all state transitions other than to
DELETE_COMPLETE should be stored in the DB.

Change-Id: If1563505e854c216c0f6a5ce84b613e1ccb74386
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2012-10-23 10:58:34.000000000', 'message': 'heat engine : Store all resource states to DB

Resources should be committed to the DB on transisiton
to CREATE_IN_PROGRESS state, otherwise resources
which take a long time to go from CREATE_IN_PROGRESS to
CREATE_COMPLETE (e.g WaitConditions) are invisible while
in the CREATE_IN_PROGRESS state to all except the thread
creating them.

Change-Id: If1563505e854c216c0f6a5ce84b613e1ccb74386
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
heat engine : Store all resource states to DB

Resources should be committed to the DB on transisiton
to CREATE_IN_PROGRESS state, otherwise resources
which take a long time to go from CREATE_IN_PROGRESS to
CREATE_COMPLETE (e.g WaitConditions) are invisible while
in the CREATE_IN_PROGRESS state to all except the thread
creating them.

Change-Id: If1563505e854c216c0f6a5ce84b613e1ccb74386
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add iSCSI-CHAP support to the volume.

Add new parameter to the volume creation, all the drivers and implement CHAP for
iSCSI driver. The target is limited to tgtadm.
Add the API to enable and disable the authentication of a volume.

Blueprint iSCSI-CHAP.

Change-Id: I51d99347aec06f6ee62a07db33bc72ac8b922c00

subject: Add iSCSI-CHAP support to volumes.

commit_message:
Add iSCSI-CHAP support to volumes.

Add three parameters chap_username, chap_password and chap_type into the cinder
client for the volume creation. Add the functions at the client side to enable and disable the authentication
for a volume.
Blueprint iSCSI-CHAP.

Change-Id: I825c79cf18795e37a90b0be99ad0b6b1fdc725e3

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-10-14 15:50:58.000000000', 'message': 'BLUEPRINT: wsgi-application-interface
BUG: Bug #1066523
When listing an empty container or account the content_length is missing from the response.

When container/account server initiates a Response with body=None (instead of an empty string), swob fails to set the content_length to zero.

The problem was detected during a GET but may exist with other requests
The offered solution includes:

1. Adding an assert to the unit test - asserting content_length of zero during the unit test that lists an empty container
2. Adding an assert to the unit test - asserting content_length of zero during the unit test that lists an empty account
3. Testing for to if not body - than setting body to an empty string.

Background: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/swift/+spec/wsgi-application-interface.

	modified:   swift/common/swob.py
	modified:   test/unit/account/test_server.py
	modified:   test/unit/container/test_server.py

Change-Id: I1b7697fc39e332c239d3701d1d7e69ffa65980cb
'}]
commit_message:
BLUEPRINT: wsgi-application-interface
BUG: Bug #1066523
When listing an empty container or account the content_length is missing from the response.

When container/account server initiates a Response with body=None (instead of an empty string), swob fails to set the content_length to zero.

The problem was detected during a GET but may exist with other requests
The offered solution includes:

1. Adding an assert to the unit test - asserting content_length of zero during the unit test that lists an empty container
2. Adding an assert to the unit test - asserting content_length of zero during the unit test that lists an empty account
3. Testing for to if not body - than setting body to an empty string.

Background: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/swift/+spec/wsgi-application-interface.

	modified:   swift/common/swob.py
	modified:   test/unit/account/test_server.py
	modified:   test/unit/container/test_server.py

Change-Id: I1b7697fc39e332c239d3701d1d7e69ffa65980cb

And a good spot, basically over-enthusiastic copy & paste from the getattr usage in the list comprehension used in _Base.extract_image_metadata (where I think it is required).

The unnecessary getattr calls are now gone.

Cheers,
Eoghan'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-10-23 08:37:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2012-10-23 08:37:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Hum, I'm pretty sure I chose the registry because you can't retrieve ALL images via the API, because it filters images by default, no matter what.

If you put an image with is_public=False in a tenant where your user is not a member of, it won't be able to retrieve the image and its details.

Did you test such a case Eoghan?"}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-10-23 08:37:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

@dhellmann

Good spot, config docco updated in the latest patch set.

@jd_

Good point, the latest patch set restores the second call with the is_public=False filter set in order to retrieve the non-public images.

Ultimately we should extend the glance API to support the all_tenants query parameter in the nova style (so that resources associated with all tenants can be retrieved via a single API call).

Cheers,
Eoghan'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-10-23 08:37:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-10-23 08:37:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Use glance public API as opposed to registry API.

Fixes bug 1064008

The motivation for switching over to the public API:

 - the registry API is more of an artifact of the internal glance
   architecture than a true public API

 - the registry API exposes internal attributes such as the backend
   store image location, which is stripped from the API-provided image
   representation for security reasons (hence should not bleed into
   metering)

 - the internalURL should be available from the keystone service catalog,
   so we can get rid of the registry host/port config

Change-Id: I0d75392066a020c608a67f1ecf0e8dba15aa48f0

[{'created': '2012-10-15 08:00:02.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes JavaScript count bug in tables.

When showing tables, and you had the summary, "No items to display",
the counter at table footer says "Displaying 1 items". This commit fixes
the inclusion of the empty line into line count.
Affected sub-pages: Instances, Volumes, Images & Snapshots, etc.

Change-Id: I24da50d506be477dffdbb0f497d88b1bd3ceacdc
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes JavaScript count bug in tables.

When showing tables, and you had the summary, "No items to display",
the counter at table footer says "Displaying 1 items". This commit fixes
the inclusion of the empty line into line count.
Affected sub-pages: Instances, Volumes, Images & Snapshots, etc.

Change-Id: I24da50d506be477dffdbb0f497d88b1bd3ceacdc

commit_message:
Check parameter 'marker' before make request to glance

fix bug: 1065053

Since glance need parameter 'marker' to be a image-id, can not
be None. check 'marker' before make request to glance.

Change-Id: I7fc063ea74ae3be71e2effdc0b62432ebdd52c27

Fix version requirement for mock library.

One of the tests uses mock.call, which is only available in version
0.8.0 and up.

Fixes bug 1066274.

commit_message:
Add noseopts and replace noseargs where needed to run_test.sh

Add of noseopts to the run_tests script so users can be
able to run tests adding extra options to be passed to
nosetests.
This option is currently in keystone but not in glance.
Fixes bug 1065758

Change-Id: I7c78749adb90b126da5bd9580da6bfd7c9e1bf54

commit_message:
Ensures that Endpoint Create does not Break Functionality

Fixes bug#1020248

Not including the optional arguments in "keystone endpoint-create"
leaves them as "None" type variables in code. The "None" variables
cause errors for subsequent functions, which breaks functionality
as described in the bug report.

Change-Id: I9b37404cc89570108aa57d3e111f67f5543257fb

[{'created': '2012-10-22 22:05:56.000000000', 'message': "Ensure device node exists before wiping during volume deletion

If the LVM device node is missing when a Cinder volume is deleted,
a large amount of data will be written to /dev/.  Check that the
device node exists before performing a _copy_volume('/dev/zero'...)
to wipe it.  Fixes bug 1070023.

Change-Id: I77a0a5545a54a4adc905a781ed8120db7adccc27
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure device node exists before wiping during volume deletion

If the LVM device node is missing when a Cinder volume is deleted,
a large amount of data will be written to /dev/.  Check that the
device node exists before performing a _copy_volume('/dev/zero'...)
to wipe it.  Fixes bug 1070023.

Change-Id: I77a0a5545a54a4adc905a781ed8120db7adccc27

commit_message:
Add meaningful server diagnostic information to fake hypervisor

Previously the fake hypervisor didn't returned a fake information similar to
the real output so this patch add this sample fake information.

Also removed a duplicated check on the tests

Change-Id: Iab72a867e6e2606beb15db17701375f3c8f61a79

commit_message:
Update volume and snapshot status on delete

Change the status of "deleting" resources at the same time we update boolean
flag for deleted.  Makes dumb queries looking for stuck statuses a little
easier.

Change-Id: Iaf3386526a369f9bf281eb4be42eb11277038c92

commit_message:
Drop duplicate sqlalchemy db api methods

Several methods were redefined at the bottom of
cinder/db/sqlalchemy/api.py. They have been removed:
- quota_get
- quota_get_all_by_project
- quota_create
- quota_update
- quota_destroy
- quota_destroy_all_by_project
- quota_class_get
- quota_class_get_all_by_name
- quota_class_create
- quota_class_update
- quota_class_destroy
- quota_class_destroy_all_by_name
- quota_usage_get
- quota_usage_get_all_by_project
- quota_usage_create
- quota_usage_update
- quota_usage_destroy

Fix bug 1070033

Change-Id: I64b0b0045af7251853da97a8a8c4b2cb09b1dd53

commit_message:
Fix Broken XML Namespace Handling

nodeName is set to ns2:metadata and not just metadata when namespaces are
specified using first example in the defect. Use tip mentioned here [1]
to support namespaces properly.

Fix one more spot where prefixes were hard coded, causing test case to fail

[1] http://stackoverflow.com/questions/2528852/how-do-i-get-minidom-to-ignore-namespaces

Fixes bug 887191

Change-Id: Iad1607682ea6d3b88f0b68c07b907d715363ebf9

heat engine : Make Resource::swift handle auth_token

Make Resource::swift() handle auth_token so the S3
resource will work with AWS auth

Fixes #271

Change-Id: Ie5aca026dea25045e42aab677a2c793c79de1658
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Create Flavors without Optional Arguments

fixes Bug #1056910

Allows the user to create a flavor without optional arguments.
The variable, ephemeral, is not currently set to a default value.
This none type value causes exceptions in subsequent code, which
occurs when specifying only mandatory parameters.

Change-Id: Ic440136b000dc296bef3bb6f8b0856ff5e7e4e79

commit_message:
path_qs for swob.Request

Add path_qs property to swob.Request. First of all this property
has webob.Request, also this property can be used in swift3 middleware
for generate canonical string, if webob will be replaced in swift3 with
swob (https://github.com/vitoordaz/swift3/commit/2b36fbd477f6573108100ec85a1594877adeaacb).

Change-Id: Idf58096baaf7830dd0d624ea6c72eda1eb91ff0d

commit_message:
Disallow updating deleted images.

1. Return a 403 Forbidden error when an admin user tries to update a deleted
image.
2. Also added unit test coverage.

Fixes LP: #1060930

Change-Id: I8290c8c9f1bcbbfbff7d54f141bdcfa1c40aab6f

I'm glad UserDict worked out for you. The only problem I've found is that the attribute access and the key access don't refer to the same underlying data model. That's not a problem here, but it's something to keep in mind for later:

  >>> import UserDict
  >>> u = UserDict.UserDict()
  >>> u.one = 'a'
  >>> u.one
  'a'
  >>> u['one'] = 'b'
  >>> u['one']
  'b'
  >>> u.one
  'a'"}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-10-22 16:06:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

commit_message:
Directly create bootable volume based on image ID.

Now that a bootable volume can be created directly based on
image ID, we can dispense with the complexity around using
a builder instance to acheive the same effect.

Change-Id: Ied1f6863a4dd21685e2f135841b9e2c4d499675f

commit_message:
XenAPI: boot_from_volume fixes - enhancements

Make boot_from_volume exercise compatible with XenServer.
- The attached device's name is retrieved from the attach results, thus
  the image builder script will access xvdb instead of vdb.
- The volume-preparator instance is stopped, because otherwise some
  processes are still holding the mount, so the volume cannot be
  detached.

Change-Id: I144e28c9b5fc68a38cd52a9e602b0e56109976e9

commit_message:
Download cirros from launchpad and cache it

Fixes bug 1068110.

images.ansolabs.com/cirros.. was not available, so this change modifies
the download location to launchpad.
The image might already been downloaded, and cached under $FILES/images
With this modification, the script is using that cache location.  Also
set the FILES variable at the top of the script

Change-Id: Idbfebce4e797256cf87a8d5ad0f42c0b3efc7148

commit_message:
Deallocate network if instance is deleted in spawn

If the instance is deleted while the virt driver is spawning, an
InstanceNotFound exception is raised and caught in compute to prevent it
from being rescheduled. This also deallocates the network to prevent
leaking interfaces/mac/ips.

* Fixes LP1068716

Change-Id: I991f5956facf7b105faea137d4a5b48897e68ae6

commit_message:
Change the service user to match devstack

The user which authenticates keystone tokens should be the "heat" user in
the "service" tenant. This changes the default configuration to do this, as
devstack already does.

Ref #269

Change-Id: I89978ec0b490f6d404c568197dd4208097a4b695
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

Previously, the service user (which authenticates tokens passes to the
engine by the APIs) was paired with the tenant of the end user to do
authentication, which worked only when they were in the same tenant. This
should not be the case, since the service user should only have an admin
role in the "service" tenant.

commit_message:
Pass the correct tenant for the service user

Previously, the service user (which authenticates tokens passes to the
engine by the APIs) was paired with the tenant of the end user to do
authentication, which worked only when they were in the same tenant. This
should not be the case, since the service user should only have an admin
role in the "service" tenant.

Fixes #269

Change-Id: I99b764fc489429dd6d081485bd89d5dde737c124
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
boot-from-volume: Cache cirros rootfs gz

A Cirros rootfs image is used to create a bootable volume. The image
might already been downloaded, and cached under $FILES/images . With
this modification, the script is using that cache location.
Also set the FILES variable at the top of the script

Change-Id: Id2b932319e5276571f669f80ecbff793a7cb6931

commit_message:
Allow local rbd user and secret_uuid configuration

By default, the rbd_user and rbd_secret_uuid are specified in the
nova-volume/cinder configuration and passed to nova-compute when
volumes are attached to instances.

This change allows these values to be specified locally in
nova-compute which means access control to RADOS devices in ceph
can be managed independently from nova-volume/cinder with no
requirement for consistent uuid's for libvirt secrets.

Fixes bug 1065883.

Change-Id: I9f07d040ae267bfbe8f794a5d22d327106314cc6

commit_message:
Pass empty args to test config parser.

This fixes bug 1056420, which allows users to pass nosetests options
through run_tests.sh again.

Change-Id: I03e84488a24e2552b61aa0cab842d8325e8e856f
(cherry picked from commit ef641597dbfc0fcb856c143b213be493ab44cc65)

[{'account_id': 1, 'date': '2012-10-21 21:17:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Do not submit

Actually, we should probably make sure quantum isn't invoked for pre-folsom branches.  Let's add that before merging this."}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2012-10-21 21:17:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2012-10-21 21:17:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2012-10-21 21:17:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: No score; No score

Devin, according to this:

https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-integration-tests-devstack-vm/3543/consoleText

Several devstack exercises failed.  Do you have thoughts on what needs to be fixed?'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2012-10-21 21:17:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: No score

Updated so that quantum is enabled only for branches other than stable/diablo and stable/essex.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2012-10-21 21:17:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Restored'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2012-10-21 21:17:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Restored'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2012-10-21 21:17:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Restored'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2012-10-21 21:17:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Restored'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2012-10-21 21:17:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Devstack-gate leaves the public interface set to the default values.  We could override it in localrc, but it seems like devstack should configure the correct values automatically when quantum is used.

Here is where the defaults are set depending on the hypervisor:

https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/blob/master/stack.sh#L321

I added Jesse and Tony to the review so they can weigh in on whether this is something that should be addressed in devstack, or we should add more configuration to devstack-gate.'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2012-10-21 21:17:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2012-10-21 21:17:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Restored'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2012-10-21 21:17:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Restored'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2012-10-21 21:17:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2012-10-21 21:17:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2012-10-21 21:17:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

That should be fixed by adding it to a files/apts/quantum file in devstack -- devstack-gate depends on devstack to install any needed packages.'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2012-10-21 21:17:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

We don't want to run _only_ the quantum script, as the purpose of the devstack gate is to verify that multiple components work correctly together; however if there are exercise scripts that don't apply when quantum is used, they can be added to the skip list (assuming equivalent functionality is tested).  The goal is to answer the question "Does OpenStack as a whole work?"'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2012-10-21 21:17:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Restored'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2012-10-21 21:17:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2012-10-21 21:17:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

In:

  http://logs.openstack.org/6641/6/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/9184/logs/localrc.txt

You can see that it is set to:

  ENABLED_SERVICES=g-api,g-reg,key,n-api,n-crt,n-obj,n-cpu,n-net,n-sch,horizon,mysql,rabbit,tempest,cinder,c-api,c-vol,c-sch,swift,quantum,q-svc,q-agt,q-dhcp'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2012-10-21 21:17:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2012-10-21 21:17:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2012-10-21 21:17:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

This now adds an _option_ to run quantum, which is off by default.  Another change: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/14534/ adds a silent job that runs this.  After it works, we can make it a gating job.'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2012-10-21 21:17:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

definitely still want to see this go in.  Do we know what next steps are?'}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-10-21 21:17:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-10-21 21:17:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

debo is still working on this, though I'm fine waiting to revive the review until he has all tests passing locally."}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-10-21 21:17:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Note: at least one of the errors is that the floating IP test is failing because the config file sets "public_interface=br100", which doesn't exist in the case of the OVS plugin.  

Does it make sense to set public interface to something like eth0 instead?  Poking around the devstack-gate code, I didn't see a location where the value of public_interface=br100 was being set, but it seems like it must be, as the default in linux_net.py is "eth0".  Can anyone point me in the right direction?  Thanks

See error: 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-integration-tests-devstack-vm/3814/artifact/logs/screen-n-net.txt'}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-10-21 21:17:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

great work on this Hua.  We're very close now.  I'll follow up with comments on https://bugs.launchpad.net/quantum/+bug/1014187.  

Once we get those changed merged in, we can revive this review."}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-10-21 21:17:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Hi James,  thanks for pointing that out.  I looked at the default in Nova's code, saw that it was being overridden, and incorrectly assumed that devstack-gate was doing that.  I agree that this is something we should address in devstack itself.  Will work on that.  Thx."}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-10-21 21:17:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

HI zhhuabj, 

I think what we want to do is look at why the exercise.sh scripts have failures when  Quantum is enabled.  See this link for detailed output of the failures: https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-integration-tests-devstack-vm/3814/consoleText

The following text on that page indicates that at least three of the tests are failing: 
=====================================================================
SKIP boot_from_volume
SKIP client-env
SKIP swift
PASS aggregates
PASS bundle
PASS client-args
PASS sec_groups
PASS volumes
FAILED euca
FAILED floating_ips
FAILED quantum
=====================================================================

Can you setup your own environment and see if you can reproduce and debug these failures?'}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-10-21 21:17:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-10-21 21:17:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

yes, sorry, should have been more clear.  What we're looking for is: 

quantum-adv-test.sh : quantum is enabled and running 

everything else:  traditional nova-network is running.

Once we get this basic quantum script in, we will add more tests that verify things like floating ips, security groups, etc. when quantum is enabled.  This current setup is just dipping our toe in the water."}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-10-21 21:17:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-10-21 21:17:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

review for specifying quantum dependencies in devstack: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/12059/'}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-10-21 21:17:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

in output I see: 

18:02:43  + echo 'WARNING: Running quantum test without enabling quantum'
18:02:43  WARNING: Running quantum test without enabling quantum

we need the following services configured: 

quantum, q-svc, q-agt, q-dhcp"}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-10-21 21:17:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

can we get a version of the gate running in a way that JUST runs the quantum script?   That is what I thought we were aiming for, but it seems like other tests are running as well.'}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2012-10-21 21:17:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2012-10-21 21:17:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: (1 inline comment)

Thanks James!'}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2012-10-21 21:17:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

euca.sh floaing_ips.sh is not working since floating ip is not integrated with nova now.
And also namespace support also needed to test.'}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2012-10-21 21:17:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Hi it looks netaddr is not installed
17:55:27  ImportError: No module named netaddr'}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2012-10-21 21:17:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

19:47:27  + euca-associate-address -i i-00000001 UnknownError: An unknown error has occurred. Please try your request again.
19:47:27  Only 1 argument (ip) permitted
19:47:27  + die 'Failure associating address UnknownError: An unknown error has occurred. Please try your request again. to i-00000001'
19:47:27  + local exitcode=1
euca.sh floating_ips are still not works. So it should be removed from quantum-gating for now.

Begin DevStack Exercise: ./exercises/

19:47:27  + set +o xtrace
19:47:27  Failure associating address UnknownError: An unknown error has occurred. Please try your request again. to i-00000001
19:47:27  =====================================================================
19:47:27  Running floating_ips
19:47:27  ====================================================================="}, {'account_id': 2711, 'date': '2012-10-21 21:17:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

hi Dan, I have found the reason why the exercise.sh scripts have failures when Quantum is enabled. now I can successfully to run all exercises in my local env.
please refer, https://bugs.launchpad.net/quantum/+bug/1014187'}, {'account_id': 2711, 'date': '2012-10-21 21:17:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

sorry for responsing so late that the status becames abandoned,

ok, I will begin to look at it from tomorrow'}, {'account_id': 2711, 'date': '2012-10-21 21:17:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

commit_message:
Add Quantum to devstack gate.

At Dan's request.

Enable quantum for all branches other than
stable/{diablo,essex}.

Change-Id: I8560ddad5981741e1bc35557616fe2a1808199e6

commit_message:
handles empty dhcp_domain with hostname in metadata

Fixes bug 1064713.

Currently hostname in metadata is created by concatenating the
instance hostname with the dhcp_domain. When dhcp_domain is empty,
it results in a hostname with a trailing dot.

Change-Id: I52a50ff7f62c0a0dc900ddf707cc3dddce62bcb3

[{'created': '2012-10-18 12:44:30.000000000', 'message': 'Do not call directly vmops.attach_volume

Relates to blueprint xenapi-volume-drivers

Driver already have an attach_volume function call which calls
volumeops.attach_volume. This change replaces the direct
volumeops.attach_volume calls with driver.attach_volume, so that
driver.attach_volume will be the entry point for attaching the volume.

Change-Id: I86e7c7df3d37076d7b7945f3504c7f305dce6820
'}]
commit_message:
Do not call directly vmops.attach_volume

Relates to blueprint xenapi-volume-drivers

Driver already have an attach_volume function call which calls
volumeops.attach_volume. This change replaces the direct
volumeops.attach_volume calls with driver.attach_volume, so that
driver.attach_volume will be the entry point for attaching the volume.

Change-Id: I86e7c7df3d37076d7b7945f3504c7f305dce6820

[{'created': '2012-10-20 14:50:28.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid leaking BDMs for deleted instances.

Fixes bug 1069099

Previously when an instance was deleted, the corresponding entries
in the block device mappings table were not also marked as deleted.

Change-Id: I0184eb2f02a9ed363019c585efffdfdb95f0bb43
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid leaking BDMs for deleted instances.

Fixes bug 1069099

Previously when an instance was deleted, the corresponding entries
in the block device mappings table were not also marked as deleted.

Change-Id: I0184eb2f02a9ed363019c585efffdfdb95f0bb43

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-10-17 02:05:53.000000000', 'message': "update kwargs with args in wrap_instance_fault

fix bug: 1067254

Since argument 'instance' maybe in args rather than in kwargs.
We need to update kwargs with args first, then we can get
'instance' from kwargs.

Change-Id: Ife89f9e9629e4b581d96289434e9ececced17915
"}, {'created': '2012-10-18 02:44:20.000000000', 'message': "update kwargs with args in wrap_instance_fault

fix bug: 1067254

If argument 'instance' stay in *args not in **kwargs.
we will get a KeyError exception which cover the real
exception. So update **kwargs with *args first, then
we can get 'instance' from kwargs easily.

Change-Id: Ife89f9e9629e4b581d96289434e9ececced17915
"}, {'created': '2012-10-19 01:46:11.000000000', 'message': "update kwargs with args in wrap_instance_fault

fix bug: 1067254

If argument 'instance' is in args rather than kwargs,
we will get a KeyError exception which will cover up
the real exception. So, we update kwargs with the
values from args first. then, we can get 'instance'
from kwargs easily.

Change-Id: Ife89f9e9629e4b581d96289434e9ececced17915
"}]
commit_message:
update kwargs with args in wrap_instance_fault

fix bug: 1067254

If argument 'instance' is in args rather than kwargs,
we will get a KeyError exception which will cover up
the real exception. So, we update kwargs with the
values from args first. then, we can get 'instance'
from kwargs easily.

Change-Id: Ife89f9e9629e4b581d96289434e9ececced17915

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-07-23 06:30:15.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for the Quantum ryu plugin.

This patch allows using the Quantum ryu plugin.
The ryu plugin lets Quantum link Open vSwitch and Ryu OpenFlow
controller[1].

The Ryu OpenFlow controller is not Openstack component, but I added some
Ryu-related processing to stack.sh for the convenience of the person who
intend to try the plugin.

Instructions for using the ryu plugin:
1. Add "quantum", "q-svc", "q-agt", "ryu", "r-svc" to ENABLED_SERVICES
2. Set "ryu" to Q_PLUGIN
3. Set public network interface to PUBLIC_INTERFACE

Example localrc:
  ENABLED_SERVICES=g-api,g-reg,key,n-api,n-crt,n-obj,n-cpu,n-net,n-vol,\
  n-sch,n-novnc,n-xvnc,n-cauth,horizon,mysql,rabbit,quantum,q-svc,q-agt,\
  ryu,r-svc
  Q_PLUGIN=ryu
  PUBLIC_INTERFACE=eth0

[1] http://osrg.github.com/ryu/

Change-Id: Ic1da132fa421f1c70c10a319ee3239831b0f956f
'}, {'created': '2012-07-23 09:50:50.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for the Quantum ryu plugin.

This patch allows using the Quantum ryu plugin.
The ryu plugin lets Quantum link Open vSwitch and Ryu OpenFlow
controller[1].

The Ryu OpenFlow controller is not Openstack component, but I added some
Ryu-related processing to stack.sh for the convenience of the person who
intend to try the plugin.

Instructions for using the ryu plugin:
1. Add "quantum", "q-svc", "q-agt", "ryu", "r-svc" to ENABLED_SERVICES
2. Set "ryu" to Q_PLUGIN
3. Set a network interface name in RYU_EXT_INTERFACE if you need

Example localrc:
  ENABLED_SERVICES=g-api,g-reg,key,n-api,n-crt,n-obj,n-cpu,n-net,n-vol,\
  n-sch,n-novnc,n-xvnc,n-cauth,horizon,mysql,rabbit,quantum,q-svc,q-agt,\
  ryu,r-svc
  Q_PLUGIN=ryu
  RYU_EXT_INTERFACE=eth0

[1] http://osrg.github.com/ryu/

Change-Id: Ic1da132fa421f1c70c10a319ee3239831b0f956f

  ryu
  Q_PLUGIN=ryu
  RYU_EXT_INTERFACE=eth0

[1] http://osrg.github.com/ryu/

Change-Id: Ic1da132fa421f1c70c10a319ee3239831b0f956f
'}, {'created': '2012-08-05 05:41:11.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for the Quantum ryu plugin.

This patch allows using the Quantum ryu plugin.
The ryu plugin lets Quantum link Open vSwitch and Ryu OpenFlow
controller[1].

The Ryu OpenFlow controller is not Openstack component, but I added some
Ryu-related processing to stack.sh for the convenience of the person who
intend to try the plugin.

Instructions for using the ryu plugin:
1. Add "quantum", "q-svc", "q-agt", "ryu" to ENABLED_SERVICES
2. Set "ryu" to Q_PLUGIN
3. Set a network interface name in RYU_EXT_INTERFACE if you need

Example localrc:
  enable_service q-svc q-agt ryu
  Q_PLUGIN=ryu
  RYU_EXT_INTERFACE=eth0

[1] http://osrg.github.com/ryu/

Change-Id: Ic1da132fa421f1c70c10a319ee3239831b0f956f

commit_message:
Add support for the Quantum Ryu plugin.

This patch allows using the Quantum Ryu plugin.
Ryu plugin lets Quantum link Open vSwitch and Ryu OpenFlow controller[1].

Ryu OpenFlow controller is not Openstack component, but I added some
processing that is related with Ryu to stack.sh for the convenience of
the person who intend to try the plugin.

Instructions for using Ryu plugin:
1. Enable services: "q-svc", "q-agt", "q-dhcp", "q-l3", "quantum", "ryu"
2. Set Q_PLUGIN to "ryu"
3. Set an internal network interface name to connect br-int on plural
   hosts to RYU_INTERNAL_INTERFACE (optional)

Example localrc:
  disable_service n-net
  enable_service q-svc q-agt q-dhcp q-l3 quantum ryu
  Q_PLUGIN=ryu
  RYU_INTERNAL_INTERFACE=eth1

[1] http://osrg.github.com/ryu/

Change-Id: Ic1da132fa421f1c70c10a319ee3239831b0f956f
